definition: nest/pit or hollow on the human body/lair/den/place/to harbor or shelter/to hold in check/to bend/classifier for litters and broods

sentences.english: It is time to renovate the nest.
What is the shape of their nests?
sentences.chinese: 它们窝巢的形状是怎样？

sentences.english: High up on the sides of a Scottish cliff, golden eagles nest in an aerie.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰高耸的悬崖边上有金雕的窝巢。

sentences.english: And alone and without his nest shall the eagle foly across the sun.
sentences.chinese: 雁鸟必须离开窝巢，才能独自飞越太阳。

sentences.english: Because the bat makes the nest in small gaps of human's house.
sentences.chinese: 因为东亚家蝠在人家的缝里做窝巢。

sentences.english: Your thoughts will stray out of your dark eyes like birds from their nests.
sentences.chinese: 你的思想将从你黝黑的眼眸中飞出，像鸟儿飞出窝巢。

definition: bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
(of a bird) to peck at food
